page.title: 17ASHCRAIG SECONDARY SCHOOL 1
page.content:
{ Ashcraig Secondary School,}situated on a very pleasant site overlooking Hogganfield Loch, is unique in that it is the only school in Scotland to provide a conventional secondary education for pupils who are either {physically or visually handicapped. The school was opened in 1983 after 10 years in the Ibrox area of Glasgow.
The school is built on one level with large, bright, open areas where pupils can meet between classes and at lunch time. A specially designed swimming pool and large, well-equipped games hall caters for the physical education needs of the school, while a physiotherapy unit copes with a variety of medical needs and is staffed by two nurses and two physiotherapists.
